automation/webhook/webhook-overview.title: Webhook overview
automation/webhook/webhook-overview.description: You can employ webhooks to notify external systems whenever there are additions, updates, or removals of rows within NocoDB. This feature allows you to receive instantaneous notifications for any changes made to your database. NocoDB also offers webhooks for bulk endpoints for creating, updating, or deleting multiple records simultaneously.

fields/field-types/custom-types/attachme.title: Attachment
fields/field-types/custom-types/attachme.description: Attachment fields allow you to upload files to your records. You can upload any file type, and the file will be linked to the record. You can also upload multiple files to a single Attachment field record.

fields/field-types/custom-types/barcode.title: Barcode
fields/field-types/custom-types/barcode.description: Barcode is a custom field type that allows you to generate a barcode from a string value. This is useful for generating barcodes for things like URLs, phone numbers, or other data that can be represented as a string.

fields/field-types/custom-types/checkbox.title: Checkbox
fields/field-types/custom-types/checkbox.description: The checkbox field type is used to store boolean values. It can be used to store a simple yes/no value, or true/false, or any other boolean value.

fields/field-types/custom-types/json.title: JSON
fields/field-types/custom-types/json.description: JSON is a custom field type that allows you to store JSON data in a field. Useful for storing data that can be represented as a JSON object, like API Response, or a set of key-value pairs.

fields/field-types/custom-types/QR-code.title: QR code
fields/field-types/custom-types/QR-code.description: QR code is a custom field type that allows you to generate a QR code from a string value. This is useful for generating QR codes for things like URLs, phone numbers, or other data that can be represented as a string.

fields/field-types/custom-types/specific.title: Specific DB type
fields/field-types/custom-types/specific.description: Create a Specific DB Type field

fields/field-types/date-time-based/date.title: Date
fields/field-types/date-time-based/date.description: Date field type is used to store date values. NocoDB supports a wide range of date formats, as detailed in the table below.

fields/field-types/date-time-based/date-.title: Date Time
fields/field-types/date-time-based/date-.description: Date Time field type is used to store both date and time values in a single field.

fields/field-types/date-time-based/durat.title: Duration
fields/field-types/date-time-based/durat.description: Duration field type is used to store duration of time in seconds or minutes. Different formats are supported by NocoDB, as detailed in the table below.

fields/field-types/date-time-based/time.title: Time
fields/field-types/date-time-based/time.description: Time field type is used to store time values in a single column. Time formats supported by NocoDB are listed in the table below.

fields/field-types/links-based/links.title: Links
fields/field-types/links-based/links.description: Links field type is used to establish relationship between tables & create links to other records.

fields/field-types/links-based/lookup.title: LookUp
fields/field-types/links-based/lookup.description: Lookup fields help bring additional field information from related table into the current table. This is useful when you want to display additional information about a record in a table. For example, if you have a table of Orders and a table of Customers, you can use a Lookup field to display the customer's name and address in the Orders table.

fields/field-types/links-based/rollup.title: Rollup
fields/field-types/links-based/rollup.description: Rollup fields are used to aggregate data from fields in the related table. Often used to calculate totals, averages, and other aggregate data.

fields/field-types/numerical/currency.title: Currency
fields/field-types/numerical/currency.description: Currency field type is used to store currency values. It is a numerical field with additional provision to set the currency symbol in display.

fields/field-types/numerical/decimal.title: Decimal
fields/field-types/numerical/decimal.description: Decimal field type is used to store decimal values. Use cases include storing salary, price, etc. NocoDB supports precision of upto 8 digits.

fields/field-types/numerical/number.title: Number
fields/field-types/numerical/number.description: Number field type is used to store numerical values. Use cases include storing age, salary, price, quantity, etc.

fields/field-types/numerical/percent.title: Percent
fields/field-types/numerical/percent.description: Percent field type is used to store percentage values. Use cases include storing discount, tax, etc.

fields/field-types/select-based/multi-se.title: Multi Select
fields/field-types/select-based/multi-se.description: Multi Select fields allow you to select multiple options from a list of options. The options can be defined in the field configuration.

fields/field-types/select-based/single-s.title: Single Select
fields/field-types/select-based/single-s.description: Single select fields allow you to select a single option from a list of options. The options can be defined in the field configuration.

fields/field-types/text-based/email.title: Email
fields/field-types/text-based/email.description: Email field is text based field custom-built for storing E-mail IDs. It is a special type of Single line text field with

fields/field-types/text-based/long-text.title: Long text
fields/field-types/text-based/long-text.description: Long Text field is text based field that allows text in multiple lines. It is useful for storing lengthy text like description, notes, etc.

fields/field-types/text-based/phonenumbe.title: Phone Number
fields/field-types/text-based/phonenumbe.description: Phone number field is text based field that allows you to store phone numbers. It also allows you to validate the phone number.

fields/field-types/text-based/single-lin.title: Single line text
fields/field-types/text-based/single-lin.description: Single line text field is a simple text based field. It can hold any text value. It is generally used for storing short text values like name, email, phone number, etc. For storing text values with multiple lines, use Long text field.

fields/field-types/text-based/url.title: URL
fields/field-types/text-based/url.description: URL field is text based field custom-built for storing URLs. It is a special type of Single line text field with

fields/multi-fields-editor.title: Multi-field editor
fields/multi-fields-editor.description: Understanding use of multi-field editor in NocoDB!

getting-started/quick-start.title: Quick start
getting-started/quick-start.description: NocoDB offers you the flexibility of two distinct variants: self-hosted and SaaS (cloud-hosted). In this section, we'll walk you through the initial steps to embark on your NocoDB journey, whether you choose to set it up on your own infrastructure or opt for the convenience of our cloud-hosted service. Let's dive in and unlock the potential of NocoDB for your data management needs.

getting-started/self-hosted/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/self-hosted/installation.description: Simple installation - takes about three minutes!

getting-started/self-hosted/upgrading.title: Upgrading
getting-started/self-hosted/upgrading.description: Upgrading NocoDB : Docker, Node and Homebrew!

getting-started/terminologies.title: NocoDB terminologies
getting-started/terminologies.description: To maximize your use of NocoDB, it's beneficial to become familiar with some common terms.

records/create-record.title: Create record
records/create-record.description: Learn how to create a record in NocoDB.

records/expand-record.title: Expanded record
records/expand-record.description: NocoDB provides Expanded Form to let you edit your data easily

records/records-overview.title: Records overview
records/records-overview.description: Learn how to create, import, and manage records in NocoDB.

roles-and-permissions/roles-permissions-.title: Roles & permissions overview
roles-and-permissions/roles-permissions-.description: Learn about roles and permissions in NocoDB.

table-operations/download.title: Download
table-operations/download.description: NocoDB offers users the ability to export data from the spreadsheet grid in a variety of formats. This feature is useful when working with large datasets and can be used in conjunction with the Filter and Sort feature to further refine your data.

table-operations/field-operations.title: Hide & reorder fields
table-operations/field-operations.description: Learn how to hide and reorder fields in NocoDB.

table-operations/filter.title: Filtering records
table-operations/filter.description: Filters provide a powerful way to narrow down and organize your data according to your specific requirements. NocoDB supports nested filters, allowing you to select multiple columns and conditions for filtering. You can choose between and or or mode of operation to combine filters, and filtering also supports Lookup, Formula, and Nested Data.

table-operations/group-by.title: Grouping records
table-operations/group-by.description: Grouping records in NocoDB allows for efficient categorization of data into specific Groups and Subgroups. NocoDB supports three levels of record segregation, providing a powerful organizational tool.

table-operations/overview.title: Table operations overview
table-operations/overview.description: Learn how to work with filters, sort, group by, and more in NocoDB.

table-operations/row-height.title: Row height
table-operations/row-height.description: NocoDB offers users the flexibility to adjust the display height of records within the spreadsheet grid to four distinct levels: Short (the default setting), Medium, Tall, and Extra. This feature proves valuable when working with extensive text columns and multi-select fields, as it enables users to present a greater amount of content within each cell.

table-operations/search.title: Search
table-operations/search.description: NocoDB offers a quick search feature that allows you to search for records by field from the toolbar menu. This feature is useful when working with large datasets and can be used in conjunction with the Filter feature to further refine your search results.

table-operations/sort.title: Sorting records
table-operations/sort.description: Sorting enables you to arrange your data alphabetically (A  Z) or (Z  A) for text based types and in ascending or descending order for numerical types. NocoDB supports nested sorting, allowing you to select fields and the order in which to apply nested sorting.

tables/actions-on-table.title: Actions on table
tables/actions-on-table.description: Learn how to rename, duplicate, and delete a table in NocoDB.

tables/create-table.title: Create empty table
tables/create-table.description: Learn how to create a table in NocoDB.

tables/create-table-via-import.title: Create table via import
tables/create-table-via-import.description: Learn how to create a table in NocoDB via import from CSV, Excel or JSON.

tables/import-data-into-existing-table.title: Import data into an existing table
tables/import-data-into-existing-table.description: Learn how to import data into an existing table in NocoDB.

tables/table-overview.title: Table overview
tables/table-overview.description: Learn how to create, import, and manage tables in NocoDB.

views/actions-on-view.title: Actions on view
views/actions-on-view.description: Learn how to delete, rename, duplicate a a view in NocoDB.

views/create-view.title: Create view
views/create-view.description: Learn how to create a view in NocoDB.

views/view-types/form.title: Form
views/view-types/form.description: Learn how to create, import, and manage forms in NocoDB.

views/view-types/gallery.title: Gallery
views/view-types/gallery.description: Gallery View allows you to display images as thumbnails with other fields just like a gallery. This view type is ideal for viewing images in a gallery-like interface. Like in Gallery, you can also perform various operations on the gallery view, such as sorting, filtering, grouping, and searching. You can also export the data in the gallery view to CSV or Excel format. This section will cover all the operations that can be performed on the gallery view.

views/view-types/grid.title: Grid
views/view-types/grid.description: Grid View, as a default type of view, allows you to display your data in a spreadsheet-like interface using rows and columns. Rows are as referred to as records and columns as fields in NocoDB.

views/view-types/kanban.title: Kanban
views/view-types/kanban.description: Learn how to use Kanban view in NocoDB.

workspaces/actions-on-workspace.title: Actions on workspace
workspaces/actions-on-workspace.description: This article explains how to rename or delete a workspace.

workspaces/create-workspace.title: Create workspace
workspaces/create-workspace.description: Learn how to create a workspace in NocoDB

workspaces/workspace-collaboration.title: Workspace collaboration
workspaces/workspace-collaboration.description: This article explains how to invite members to your workspace, change their roles and procedure to remove them from the workspace.

workspaces/workspace-overview.title: Workspace overview
workspaces/workspace-overview.description: This article briefs the concept of workspaces in NocoDB.
